title: Synthetic Recap
body:
BOSTON (AP) – They came to witness the timeless clash of green and gold, Celtics versus Lakers. They left having borne witness to a force of nature named Shaquille O’Neal.

In a 118-103 Lakers victory on Boston’s hallowed parquet floor, O’Neal didn’t just play basketball; he authored a symphony of pure dominance. His final line was not merely impressive; it was historic: a colossal 41 points, 23 rebounds, and 6 assists. From the opening tip, this was his canvas, and he painted with brute force and astonishing grace.

The Celtics, with no answer for the onslaught, could only watch as O’Neal imposed his will. He was an immovable object in the paint, vacuuming rebounds with a voracious appetite. When he wasn’t powering through double-teams for thunderous dunks, he was finding open teammates, dishing out a team-high six assists and shattering the predictable double-team.

While the Lakers’ supporting cast, including Eddie Jones’s 19 points, provided crucial support, this night was unequivocally about the man in the middle. Every drop-step, every blocked shot, every roar after an and-one was a declaration of supremacy. The Celtics' effort, led by Antoine Walker's 22 points, was simply rendered irrelevant in the face of such an individual typhoon.

On a court steeped in legends, from Russell to Bird to Magic, Shaquille O’Neal carved his own chapter with a performance for the ages. It was more than a win; it was a statement, a 48-minute masterpiece that reminded everyone why he was the most unstoppable force in the game.
